intro: Rosa orophila, commonly known as the Sierra rose, is a species of flowering plant native to the high elevations of the Sierra Nevada mountain range in California. It is a shrub that typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist climates. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and its stems are covered in soft, glandular hairs. Rosa orophila is valued for its ornamental beauty and is also an important part of the local ecosystem.
